designScenario.name: Air Supply System
designScenario.description: The Air Supply System is designed to provide a continuous supply of pressurized, filtered, and conditioned air to the aircraft cabin. It integrates advanced airflow management, filtration, and distribution technologies to ensure passenger safety, comfort, and adherence to aviation standards. The system is engineered to handle variable flight conditions, including altitude changes, while maintaining air purity and circulation. It incorporates redundant components and real-time monitoring to ensure fault tolerance and rapid response to deviations.

details.description: The system shall deliver a minimum airflow of 5000 CFM to the cabin under nominal flight conditions to ensure adequate ventilation.
The system must filter particulates, allergens, and contaminants using HEPA and activated carbon filters to meet FAA air quality standards.
Maintain cabin pressure within 0.8 atm to 1.2 atm during all flight phases using pressure regulators and bleed air systems.
The system must respond to pressure drops or airflow blockages within 2 seconds to prevent cabin depressurization.
Implement dual redundant compressors and filtration paths to ensure continuous air supply during single-component failure.
All components shall be modular and accessible via standardized access panels for rapid servicing during ground maintenance.

systemComponents.name: Air Compressor Module
systemComponents.description: Core component responsible for pressurizing bleed air from the engines and distributing it to cabin systems.

subComponents.name: Compressor Motor
subComponents.description: Variable-speed motor driven by engine bleed air to regulate airflow pressure.

subComponents.name: Pressure Regulator
subComponents.description: Controls outlet pressure to maintain safe cabin pressure levels.

systemComponents.name: Filter Bank Assembly
systemComponents.description: Multi-stage filtration unit removing particulates, microbes, and gaseous contaminants from cabin air.

subComponents.name: HEPA Filter
subComponents.description: High-efficiency particulate air filter capturing 99.97% of particles ≥0.3 µm.

subComponents.name: Activated Carbon Filter
subComponents.description: Adsorbs volatile organic compounds and odors from cabin air.

systemComponents.name: Distribution Network
systemComponents.description: Network of ducts and valves directing conditioned air to cabin zones while maintaining pressure equilibrium.

subComponents.name: Main Duct Assembly
subComponents.description: Primary airflow pathway constructed from fire-resistant composite materials.

subComponents.name: Zone Control Valves
subComponents.description: Automated dampers regulating airflow distribution to passenger and crew compartments.

systemComponents.name: Oxygen Supply Unit
systemComponents.description: Emergency oxygen delivery system with independent supply for rapid deployment during cabin depressurization.

subComponents.name: Oxygen Canisters
subComponents.description: High-pressure oxygen storage cylinders meeting FAA capacity requirements.

subComponents.name: Deployment Mechanism
subComponents.description: Pyrotechnic-actuated valve system releasing oxygen masks automatically.

systemComponents.name: Air Quality Monitor
systemComponents.description: Sensor array continuously measuring oxygen levels, CO2 concentration, and particulate counts.

subComponents.name: Oxygen Sensor
subComponents.description: Electrochemical sensor ensuring cabin oxygen levels remain ≥19.5%.

subComponents.name: CO2 Analyzer
subComponents.description: Non-dispersive infrared sensor tracking CO2 concentrations below 1000 ppm.

relationships.description: The compressor provides pressurized air to the distribution network's main duct assembly.
Filtered air from the filter bank must be routed through the distribution network to reach cabin zones.
The oxygen supply unit activates when the air quality monitor detects unsafe oxygen levels.
The pressure regulator is an integral component of the compressor module assembly.
The zone control valves are part of the distribution network's airflow regulation subsystem.

attributes.name: airflowRate
attributes.description: Nominal airflow delivered to the cabin under standard flight conditions.

attributes.name: pressureRange
attributes.description: Operating pressure envelope maintained within the cabin.

attributes.name: filterEfficiency
attributes.description: HEPA filter efficiency rating for particulate removal.

attributes.name: responseTime
attributes.description: Maximum time to respond to pressure deviations or airflow blockages.

attributes.name: oxygenConcentration
attributes.description: Regulated oxygen level in cabin air.

attributes.name: oxygenCapacity
attributes.description: Emergency oxygen supply duration per storage canister.

comments.body: OxygenSupplyUnit provides redundant emergency supply with pyrotechnic deployment mechanism
